review_title: Promoting a bilingual Canada is fulfilling work
pros: Credible organization, strong sense of mission, small and flexible.
cons: Non-profit working within a limited budget; always too much work to accomplish.

review_title: Young and casual work environment, low-pay, but lots of fun.
pros:
Very fun, collaborative working environment. I had a lot of freedom in taking projects where I wanted them to go,

Perks: banked hours, flex-time, opportunities to travel - after taking a weekend work trip, I banked almost a week's worth of hours and got to take that as extra paid vacation time. Summer office hours were only four days per week.
cons: low pay, strict funding - even though we had a budget surplus, we couldn't do whatever we wanted with it. very limited research capacity - they mostly rely on summer students.
